feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: About displaying and hiding SAC's “collaboration column and line” data labels.
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Is it possible to toggle the display of data labels for columns and lines separately in SAC's “collaboration column and line”?
The standard function allows you to toggle the display of data labels for both columns and lines, but
is there a way to display data labels for columns and not display data labels for lines?

For example, I want to hide the parts marked with yellow markers.

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: The direction of axis labels when there are multiple key items in a SAC chart.
entry.content:
Hello Community,

This is about “axis label direction” when using SAC's "Combination Column & Line" and "Bar/Column" charts.

If multiple measurement items are selected, changing the SAC standard setting item "axis label direction" will not cause the axis labels to be displayed diagonally.

Is it possible to display the axis labels diagonally?
If they are not displayed diagonally, the item names are abbreviated, making them very difficult to read.

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Is it possible to specify the grid interval for charts in SAC?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

In SAC charts, you can specify the maximum and minimum values of the axis as standard settings, but there does not appear to be a place to specify the interval between axes.
The interval is automatically determined by SAC.

 

 

Is there a way to achieve the following regarding the spacing between axes?
1. Specify the spacing between axes numerically.
2. Select the spacing between axes from options such as narrow, standard, or wide.

 

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Rolling Sum on a Sorted Measure
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have a table with Net Sales, initially sorted ascending by Customer. I want the rolling sum of Net Sales to follow a descending Net Sales order, but even after sorting the table by Net Sales (descending), the rolling sum still uses the initial alphabetical order of Customer.  Any suggestions on how to fix this?

Thanks in Advance,
Sangey

Inititally:

After Sorting:

entry.title: SAC: How to prevent extending the planning area during execution of a data action?
entry.content:
In a planning model with the option "Based on Data Access Control and Model Privacy" enabled for "Recommended Planning Area", a Data Action Starter with the option "Recommended Planning Area" still automatically expands the planning area during execution.

How can this be prevented?

We are currently on the 2025 Q3 release.

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Cost Center Splitting Weights Integrated Financial Planning
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone please guide me on how we obtain the % splitting weight in the Operating Expense Cost Center Splitting Weights → Operating Expense Planning → Administration tab?

I’m unable to understand how the percentages (e.g., 80% and 20%) are derived against the cost center activity type. From what I see, the calculation uses a restricted measure labeled Subtotal Driver 2, which is then referenced in the % Splitting Weight calculated measure.

However, when I add this restricted measure (Subtotal Driver 2) to a story table and simply edit the story measure (even without changing any parameters, keeping it exactly as is), the value changes.

Why does this happen, and how can we ensure the value remains constant (e.g., 50%)?

When I edit the measure without making any changes — keeping in mind that this is standard content — the value still changes.

when I click on ok.. values get changed 

please guide

entry.title: Data transfer from multiple models to one common model in SAC Planning
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

We’ve created four separate models in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). At the story level, we’ve blended these models using common dimensions aligned with a primary model.

However, when we attempt to perform calculations involving measures from multiple models, SAC throws errors — even when using functions like resultlookup

As a workaround, we’d like to consolidate data from all four models into a single common model. This would allow us to calcualtions

Model A -- Emp No,Status,srvdate,company code,FRSPla,FRS Rate hrlyrate,salary etc....
ModelB--  BenefitRate,FRS Plan,FRS Rate
MoodelC--Company code, FiscalYear, YrsSRVfrom,YsrSRV TO
ModelD- EmpNo,Leave Type,Fiscal year,leave type ,leave yeast, Blc hrs 
ModelE- Empno,Leavetype.fyYear,leave type leave yr

Primary model has more dimensions which is not in othe models,

Can anyone advise on the best approach to achieve this?

entry.title: Measures or account dimension in term of performance - SAC for planning
entry.content:
I have the following dilemma.
I have a new model and I don't need both account and measures. therefore, the first option is to create an account dimension and one "value" measure. Or a list of ~50 measures and no-account dimension.

I have few design reasons to prefer one of the options,

however my question is which option will provide a better performance?

 

thank you

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: SAP Joule Introduction and its applications in SAP FICO
entry.content:
What Is SAP Joule?

SAP Joule is SAP’s AI copilot embedded across its cloud applications. It offers four interaction types—Transactional, Navigational, Informational, and Analytical—that let users perform business tasks via natural language within SAP environments. It understands user context, roles, permissions, and remains secure by design. It can also ground responses in your own business documents.

 How SAP Joule works in Public vs. Private Cloud is one of the most important considerations for finance teams (especially in FICO) deciding on adoption.

Here’s a structured view:

🔹 SAP Joule in Public vs. Private Cloud

  1. Deployment & Integration
  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
    • Joule is natively embedded and updated by SAP automatically.
    • Integration with SAP FICO apps (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, Controlling) is out of the box.
    • No additional installation required - users just activate and configure.
  • Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)
    • Joule can be enabled, but may require additional setup and integration.
    • Some Joule features might lag behind public cloud, because public gets innovations first.
    • Still integrates with FICO, but might require extra configuration & tenant connections to SAP BTP.
  1. Feature Availability
  • Public Cloud
    • Joule supports all 4 interaction types (Transactional, Navigational, Informational, Analytical) directly in Fiori apps.
    • Example in FICO: “Post vendor invoice” → transaction executes directly.
    • Faster delivery of Joule Agents and Joule Studio.
  • Private Cloud
    • Informational & Analytical features available early (queries, reports, insights).
    • Transactional flows may require enablement through custom skills/agents.
    • Joule Studio can still be connected via SAP BTP, but adoption speed depends on customer’s upgrade cycle.
  1. Customization & Extensibility
  • Public Cloud
    • Limited custom coding—extensions must go through SAP BTP side-by-side development.
    • Joule skills/agents are mostly standardized.
    • Great if you want speed & standardization.
  • Private Cloud
    • More flexibility: you can create custom FICO processes, reports, and Joule agents.
    • Easier to integrate with on-prem or legacy systems.
    • Suited for companies with complex finance processes.
  1. Data Security & Residency
  • Public Cloud
    • Data is hosted on SAP-managed hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP, SAP DCs).
    • Joule queries financial data via secure APIs; customers rely on SAP’s compliance.
  • Private Cloud
    • You control hosting, location, and more of the security stack.
    • Some finance-heavy industries (banking, defense, public sector) may prefer this for regulatory reasons.
  1. Upgrade & Innovation
  • Public Cloud
    • Quarterly upgrades → Joule features arrive first and fastest.
    • Example: New Joule Agents for FICO tasks (like dispute resolution) appear immediately.
  • Private Cloud
    • Annual upgrades (with optional Feature Packs).
    • Joule features arrive later—innovation follows public cloud by a few cycles.

📊 Comparison Table

Aspect

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Availability

Native, out-of-the-box

Needs setup, later adoption

Updates

Quarterly, fastest innovations

Annual/controlled upgrades

Customization

Limited, BTP-based

Flexible, deep customizations

Security

SAP-managed hyperscalers

Customer-controlled

FICO Use Cases

Immediate transactional & analytical support

Strong for complex, regulated finance scenarios

Joule Studio

Fully available

Available via BTP, more flexible

✅ Which is Better for FICO?

  • Public Cloud → Best if you want rapid innovation, standard finance processes, faster AI adoption.
  • Private Cloud → Best if you need deep customization, strict compliance, hybrid IT integration.

 SAP Joule version requirements for S/4HANA Cloud editions (Public and Private):

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Joule arrived as part of the Public Cloud starting around Q3 2024, and is embedded in all releases thereafter, including 2408 (August 2024) and onward.
  • While Joule is built into these releases, you still need proper entitlement and authorization to use it; this may require activation via your SAP admin or account executive.
  • There are setup guides available detailing how to activate Joule once entitlement is granted.

In Summary:

If your system is on Public Cloud release 2408 (Aug 2024) or later, Joule is already supported—assuming you've got the right access and permissions.

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Joule is available in the Private Cloud as well, but requires setup and configuration. It's not automatically active—you must enable it via SAP BTP and Joule Studio.
  • Technical prerequisites include ensuring the UI5 version in your system meets or exceeds the minimum required for Joule integration. The specific UI5 version will depend on your release; you can consult SAP documentation for exact details.

In Summary:

Private Cloud systems can support Joule—but you must set it up, ensure the UI5 stack is compatible, and configure the feature via BTP.

  1. SAP S/4HANA On-Premise (Classic)
  • Joule is not supported on on-premise S/4HANA. SAP has confirmed it's not on the current roadmap for classic on-premise systems.
  • There’s a planned strategy—possibly coming Q1 2025—to enable Joule via SAP Build Work Zone, BTP, and Joule Studio even for on-prem systems. But as of now, Joule remains unavailable on-prem and unsupported.

High-Level Overview

Edition

Supported from (release)

Requirements

Public Cloud

2408 (Aug 2024) onward

Needs entitlement/authorization & activation

Private Cloud

Post-2024 releases

Requires UI5 prerequisites + BTP/Joule Studio setup

On-Premise (classic)

Not supported (as of now)

No Joule availability; roadmap may include future BTP-based solution

Summary:

  • Public Cloud: Joule is supported starting with 2408 onward—activate it via entitlement.
  • Private Cloud: Joule is available but not automatic—requires UI compliance + setup via BTP.
  • On-Premise: Joule is not supported yet; no built-in version availability.

Here’s how SAP Joule, SAP’s generative AI assistant, can be applied specifically within the SAP FICO (Finance & Controlling) domain:

SAP Joule Application in FICO

  1. Transactional Interactions

Joule allows users to perform CRUD operations and manage financial documents via natural language—imagine asking:

  • “Post a vendor invoice of $5,000 to account X with due date Y.”
  • “Show me the status of PO invoice 10234.”
    While SAP hasn't yet released out-of-the-box FICO conversational flows, Joule’s transactional model supports this kind of interaction across cloud applications.
  1. Navigational Interactions

Instead of navigating through menus to reach Fiori apps like “Display GL Account Balances,” you could simply ask:

  • “Where can I review G/L balances?”
    Joule will direct you to the relevant screen.
  1. Informational Interactions

Straight answers instead of digging through help docs. You can ask:

  • “What’s the difference between cost center and profit center accounting?”
  • “Explain account determination for automatic postings.”
    Joule will deliver concise explanations, referencing SAP documentation or your own policy documents.
  1. Analytical Interactions

Joule bridges your natural-language queries to data analytics:

  • “Show me quarterly expense trends per cost center.”
  • “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
    It returns charts, metrics, or dashboards—leveraging SAP Analytics Cloud integration.

Advanced: Joule Agents & Studio

Joule Agents

SAP has introduced AI agents—autonomous actors capable of executing complex, multi-step workflows across business functions. In FICO, custom agents could:

  • Automate dispute resolution: Collaborate across finance and service teams to validate discrepancies and propose corrections.
  • Cash collection workflows: Analyze overdue invoices, coordinate with collections, and initiate follow-ups.
    These agents are part of SAP’s cross-functional automation strategy.

Joule Studio (within SAP Build)

No-code/low-code tool to create custom skills or agents tailored for your FICO needs:

  • Build a skill to automatically generate internal financial reports, or trigger approval workflows.
  • Automate vendor reconciliation or recurring postings by designing tailored AI agents.
    These skills and agents integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems.

Summary Table

Joule Capability

FICO Use Case Example

Transactional

Post invoices, check payment status via natural language

Navigational

Ask “Where to view Cost Center Reports?”

Informational

Clarify financial terms or posting rules

Analytical

Generate trends and KPI charts using SAC

Agents & Studio

Automate dispute resolution, cash collection, approvals

Key Benefits in FICO

  • Boost Productivity: Save time by speaking instead of clicking through screens.
  • Reduce Errors: Leverage conversational clarity and auto-generated documents.
  • Improve Insights: Conduct data reviews and root cause analysis through simple dialogue.
  • Automate Complex Workflows: Agents handle multi-step tasks such as reconciliations or approvals automatically.

Real-World Usage Context -- Caveats

While SAP is rapidly developing Joule’s capabilities, many implementations remain in pilot or PoC stages. Users in forums report limited early usage, primarily for basic navigation or queries.

 

Here are concrete FICO scenarios where you could pilot SAP Joule and even extend it with Joule Agents / Studio:

🔹 Pilot Scenarios in SAP FICO

  1. Invoice & Payment Handling
  • Ask Joule:
    “Post an invoice for vendor ABC with $12,000 due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Action: Creates the posting, validates tax code, and confirms with you.
  • Extension with Agent: Automate follow-up—if payment not cleared by due date, Joule Agent triggers a reminder email or escalates.
  1. Month-End Close Assistant
  • Ask Joule:
    “What are the pending tasks for month-end close?”
  • Joule Action: Lists open items (accruals, GR/IR clearing, reconciliations).
  • Extension with Agent: Automate recurring accrual postings and send alerts to approvers who are late in providing confirmations.
  1. Financial Analysis & Insights
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me expense trend per cost center for last 6 months.”
  • Joule Action: Returns a chart (via SAC integration).
  • Extension with Agent: Forecast next quarter’s expenses and flag cost centers that may exceed budgets.
  1. Audit & Compliance Checks
  • Ask Joule:
    “List journal entries above $50,000 in the last quarter without approvals.”
  • Joule Action: Generates a filtered list.
  • Extension with Agent: Create an automated internal audit agent that periodically checks for compliance exceptions and notifies controllers.
  1. Treasury & Cash Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “What is today’s cash position?”
  • Joule Action: Summarizes bank balances, incoming/outgoing payments.
  • Extension with Agent: Auto-generate a daily treasury dashboard at 9 AM and send to CFO.
  1. Dispute & Collections Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me customers with invoices overdue > 60 days.”
  • Joule Action: Lists overdue accounts.
  • Extension with Agent: An AI agent sends personalized payment reminders and schedules calls with collections staff.
  1. Budget vs. Actual Control
  • Ask Joule:
    “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
  • Joule Action: Shows variances with drill-down.
  • Extension with Agent: Automatically notify budget owners when variances exceed a threshold (say 10%).

🔹 How to Design in Joule Studio

In Joule Studio (within SAP Build) you can:

  1. Create a Skill → “Generate quarterly P&L by company code and send PDF to finance team.”
  2. Create an Agent → “Monitor overdue vendor payments and auto-initiate dunning.”
  3. Connect Non-SAP Apps → e.g., send approvals via MS Teams or Slack.

👉 This way, Joule moves from a copilot (answering queries) to a colleague (executing finance tasks for you).

 

Deep Dive on one of the real-world example: Vendor Invoice Posting with SAP Joule in Public vs Private Cloud.

🧾 Example: Vendor Invoice Posting with Joule

🔹 Scenario

A finance user wants to post a vendor invoice for Vendor 300012, amount $12,000, due in 30 days.

1️⃣ Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Understands the intent (“Create Vendor Invoice”).
    2. Pulls relevant master data (Vendor 300012 details, tax code, payment terms).
    3. Pre-fills the invoice screen in Fiori.
    4. User confirms → Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Public Cloud:
    • Joule can immediately display the document number and due date schedule.
    • If connected to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Joule can also show how this impacts cash outflow forecast.
    • Minimal setup → available out-of-the-box.

2️⃣ Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Joule recognizes intent, but instead of direct posting, it may:
      • Provide navigation → “Open FB60 (Vendor Invoice Entry)” or “Fiori App: Create Supplier Invoice.”
      • Pre-fill metadata only if integrated with custom Joule Skill via Joule Studio.
    2. User manually confirms or adjusts in the classic posting screen (e.g., FB60 / MIRO).
    3. Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Private Cloud:
    • You can customize Joule Agent (via Joule Studio + BTP) to enforce company-specific validations (e.g., block invoices >$10,000 without 2 approvals).
    • Joule can connect to legacy non-SAP apps (like OCR invoice scanners or in-house workflow systems).
    • Requires more setup & governance compared to Public Cloud.

📊 Side-by-Side Comparison

Step

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Activation

Native, plug-and-play

Needs setup & integration

Invoice Posting

Joule executes directly in Fiori app

Joule suggests navigation, may require custom agent for automation

Data Validation

Standard rules auto-applied

Flexible, can embed custom compliance rules

User Effort

Minimal (voice/text → posted)

Moderate (confirmation in screen, extra steps if no custom agent)

Analytics

Immediate cash flow impact via SAC

Possible, but may need manual SAC integration

Customization

Limited (SAP-standard process)

Flexible (custom workflows, approvals, legacy integration)

✅ Takeaway:

  • In Public Cloud, Joule = speed + simplicity → perfect for companies with standard finance processes.
  • In Private Cloud, Joule = control + flexibility → better if you need extra compliance steps, custom posting logic, or hybrid integration.

Joule SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Service SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Sales

entry.title: Interactive Measure Filtering with User Inputs in SAC
entry.content:
I would like to filter a key figure in my table, but so far I haven’t been able to do it. I found a post  where this issue was solved using a script variable. However, the script variable was created directly in the story. As a result, it is not visible in the model when trying to create a new calculated measure there, as described in the post.
Has anyone already solved this problem?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: How to filter data based on measure values in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a requirement in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) related to filtering measures in a table after aggregation.

My Dataset:

At the base level, my dataset contains:

  • Sales Order
  • Sales Order Line Item
  • Order Quantity
  • Delivered Quantity
  • Open Value

Requirement:

In an SAC story page, I have a table widget. I want to display only the data where Open Value > 0.

However, I cannot directly apply a filter on the dataset level because the data is stored at Sales Order + Line Item granularity.

  • If I apply a filter at dataset level → it will filter at line item level before aggregation.
  • What I actually need → filtering should happen after aggregation, based on the fields I place in the table.

Example:

Case 1 – Dimension: Sales Order only

  • If I place only Sales Order in the table → all measures (Order Quantity, Delivered Quantity, Open Value) will aggregate at Sales Order level.
  • Then the filter Open Value > 0 should apply after aggregation.

Case 2 – Dimension: Sales Order + Line Item

  • If I add Sales Order Line Item dimension → the measures will now be at line-item level.
  • Then again, the filter Open Value > 0 should apply at this level of aggregation.

Question:

How can I achieve this behavior in SAC? Is there a way to apply a post-aggregation filter in SAC tables?

Expected Outcome:

The filter should always respect the granularity of the table view (i.e., based on dimensions in the table), instead of applying at the lowest level of the dataset.

SAP Analytics Cloud SAP Analytics Cloud, data modeling SAP Analytics Cloud, analytics designer

entry.title: SAP analytics cloud Plannung

We have by default filters "onInitialization" page event, when loading the page first time table refreshing and again script code (filter) executing means two times table executing/refreshing.

Regards,

Mahadev Jundale

entry.title: How can I create a button that fully replicates Edit → Reset in Analytics Designer?
entry.content:
I need a single button that returns the app to its initial state—exactly like Edit → Reset. That means:

  • Clear all Input Controls (back to “All members”)

  • Clear chart selections / Linked Analysis so app-level compound filters (e.g., “Location + Company”) disappear from Applied to all pages

  • Remove all dimension filters from widget DataSources and File Data Sources

Questions

  1. Is there a supported API to trigger the exact same behavior as Edit → Reset from a button?
  2. Is there any scripting API to iterate all dimensions of a model (not just those currently filtered) to ensure complete cleanup?
  3. Any official docs or sample implementations that demonstrate a robust “Reset” button in Analytics Designer?

Thanks in advance for guidance!

entry.title: Regarding the Triangle Display on SAC Bar Charts
entry.content:
Hello Community,

In SAC bar charts, setting “Show as” to Triangle under ‘color’ displays a “◀” symbol.

Is it possible to change this “◀” display to another symbol?
For example, can we display a circle “●” or a square “■”?

When displaying multiple “◀” symbols, using only the same symbol may make the chart difficult to read. I would like to know if it's possible to use other symbols instead.

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.
